comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: 75 MAGDALENE VINNEN photos (so far) - enough to make a movie!   They are a fantastic close-up record of everyday life aboard a working sailing vessel in port.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] That's what I was thinking! It's the most comprehensive record of a cargo ship, and a sailing one at that in port that I've been able to find in the collection so far. Some of these photographs appear on display enlarged on the walls here at the museum in our Wharf 7 Maritime Heritage Centre. It's a beautiful space if you ever get the chance to see it :)
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] That's great - I must get there - one day.  Do the current owners of the SEDOV know about this series?

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Current position of the SEDOV - hit "Current Vessel's Track" - www.marinetraffic.com/ais/shipdetails.aspx?mmsi=273510000 (sometimes I am blown away by the information available on the interweb!)

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] we'll definitely get in touch with them and keep you posted of any developments. We thought we were the only ones that used the term interweb! :P
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
